meanings.definition: A period of paid leave granted to a university teacher for study or travel, traditionally every seventh year.
meanings.sent1: During his sabbaticals, Professor Smith traveled to different countries to learn about their cultures.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often use their sabbaticals to explore new research topics and enhance their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The sabbaticals allowed the professor to take a break from teaching and focus on personal growth.
meanings.sent4: Her sabbaticals were like a refreshing breeze, rejuvenating her passion for education.
meanings.sent5: The sabbaticals provided a valuable opportunity for academic enrichment and self-discovery.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which someone does not work at his or her regular job and is able to rest, travel, do research, etc.
meanings.sent1: After working tirelessly for years, she finally took sabbaticals to recharge and explore new hobbies.
meanings.sent2: During his sabbaticals, John enjoyed hiking, painting, and spending time with his family.
meanings.sent3: The sabbaticals felt like a well-deserved break from the daily grind of work.
meanings.sent4: Her sabbaticals were a journey of self-discovery, leading to new perspectives and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The sabbaticals offered a chance to unwind, reflect, and come back refreshed to work.
